climbs.name: Drillas in the Mist
climbs.fa: Tristan Burnham, Becca Tarbox, Doug Plorde 3/21/2020

content.description: This route was was bolted ground up on lead. 4 bolted pitches close to Portland.Pitch 1: 5.10 - Up a gully with funky bolt locations due to rock quality. (80ft) Pitch 2: 5.4 - This is the money pitch, a really fun traverse out left across the slab. A few little up and down moves to get to the best holds. (60ft) Pitch 3: 5.2 - A really easy and grassy pitch up to a huge sloping ledge. (70ft)Pitch 4: 5.6 - Head out left and then up and right, a few little power moves and mantles to an easy ridge scramble. There’s bolted anchors or head to the forest and anchor off a tree. (95ft)
content.protection: Bolted all the way with bolted anchors and rap rings. No trad gear needed.
content.location: Follow the taped “trail” up and left through the forest crossing a few creeks. Once at the crag, this route starts in a gully on the right hand side. Approach takes about an hour.

content.description: A small little crag overlooking French's Dome off Lolo Pass.
